conclusion: Analyze paths from points A, B, C, and D to containers E and F.
Liquid starts flowing from point A.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (yellow).
Baffle redirects the flow downward.
Liquid moves towards the left side of the container as blocked by baffles and wall.
Liquid continues to flow down and reaches container E.
Liquid starts flowing from point B.
Liquid flows vertically downward due to no immediate obstacles.
Liquid continues straight down and fills container E.
Liquid starts flowing from point C.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (blue).
Baffle redirects the flow slightly to the right.
Another baffle (green) redirects the flow more towards the right.
Liquid continues flowing down and reaches container F.
Liquid starts flowing from point D.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (white).
Baffle redirects the flow slightly to the right.
Another baffle (cyan) redirects the flow more towards the right.
Liquid continues flowing down and reaches container F.
Point A: Liquid flows into container E.
Point B: Liquid flows into container E.
Point C: Liquid flows into container F.
Point D: Liquid flows into container F.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and B flows into E; liquid from C and D flows into F.
